title: CRAN Release Checklist for Biodiversity Dashboard Package
text: Update package version DESCRIPTION file Check dependencies properly declared DESCRIPTION (Imports, Suggests, Depends) Ensure exported functions proper documentation (@export, @examples, etc.) Update NEWS.md changes new version Update README.md current information Check vignettes --date build correctly Ensure LICENSE file matches license declared DESCRIPTION

title: CRAN Release Checklist for Biodiversity Dashboard Package
text: Run R CMD check ‚Äì-cran locally fix errors, warnings, notes Run devtools::check() rcmdcheck::rcmdcheck(args = c("---cran")) Check package R-devel possible Run devtools::spell_check() check spelling Run goodpractice::gp() additional best practices

title: CRAN Release Checklist for Biodiversity Dashboard Package
text: Ensure tests cover main functionality Run devtools::test() run tests Check test coverage covr::package_coverage() Test multiple platforms possible (Windows, macOS, Linux) Test different R versions possible

title: CRAN Release Checklist for Biodiversity Dashboard Package
text: Ensure package size 5MB (good reason larger) Ensure examples, vignettes, tests run 5 seconds Check code writes user‚Äôs home directory without permission Ensure examples/tests write system files directories Check \dontrun{} used necessary Ensure functions don‚Äôt modify user options without resetting

title: CRAN Release Checklist for Biodiversity Dashboard Package
text: Build source package devtools::build() Check package CRAN policy devtools::check_rhub() Check win-builder devtools::check_win_devel() R CMD check results Downstream dependencies check results (applicable) Explanation NOTE/WARNING fixed Explanation changes update

title: CRAN Release Checklist for Biodiversity Dashboard Package
text: Submit CRAN using devtools::release() via web form Wait confirmation email CRAN Address feedback CRAN maintainers promptly

title: Shiny dashboard that visualize observed species on map for Biodiversity data
text: Biodiversity Dashboard sophisticated Shiny application designed visualize explore biodiversity data. allows users search species scientific vernacular names displays observation data interactive maps timeline visualizations.

title: Shiny dashboard that visualize observed species on map for Biodiversity data
text: Interactive Species Search: Find species using scientific vernacular names Dynamic Map Visualization: View species observations geographically Temporal Analysis: Explore species observed timeline visualizations Fast Performance: Optimized quick initialization responsive interactions Modern UI: Styled CSS/Sass enhanced user experience

title: Shiny dashboard that visualize observed species on map for Biodiversity data
text: Species Search Functionality: Users can search species using scientific vernacular names. application displays observations map search returns matching names. Informative Default View Default view presents meaningful data rather empty map plot. Timeline Visualization Visualization temporal patterns selected species observed. Public Deployment Available github.io Modular Architecture Implemented Shiny modules: mod_loadData, mod_timelineVisualization, mod_viewMap. Test Coverage Added unit tests critical functions edge cases. Enhanced Styling Used fresh Sass improved aesthetics. Performance Optimization Shiny caching application performance memoise function memoization Fast data loading data.table::fread() Internal data storage sysdata.rda Server-side-selectize inputs JavaScript libraries (Echarts4r, leaflet) visualization shinyWidgets input components JavaScript Visualizations Used JavaScript map popups, labels, monthly occurrence plots. Dynamic UI Module Created separate module species selection based name typ Code Refactoring Functions dropdownBasedOnRadioBtn updatedropdownBasedOnRadioBtn, numbered modules, dark mode support.

title: Shiny dashboard that visualize observed species on map for Biodiversity data
text: Enhanced JavaScript Integration Implement rich media elements popups, interactive labels, loading spinners custom JavaScript engaging user experience. Comprehensive Test Coverage Expand unit testing cover additional functions edge cases, ensuring robust application behavior across scenarios. CI/CD GitHub Actions Implement automated workflows continuous integration deployment, including: Automated R CMD check across multiple operating systems Code coverage reporting Automated package testing pull requests Seamless deployment GitHub Pages shinyapps.io Modern UI bslib Transition bs4Dash bslib polished interface, leveraging: Bootstrap 5 components utilities Custom theming Sass variables Responsive card-based layouts Improved dark mode implementation Comprehensive Documentation Create deploy extensive documentation including: Function reference examples User guides vignettes Developer guidelines Interactive tutorials Automated deployment GitHub Pages using pkgdown Expanded Testing Add test cases broader function coverage.

title: Create Interactive Bar Plot with echarts4r ‚Äî create_bar_plot
text: function creates interactive bar chart visualization using echarts4r library. visualization includes interactive features data zooming, tooltips, export options. supports light dark themes flg_darkMode parameter.

title: Create Interactive Bar Plot with echarts4r ‚Äî create_bar_plot
code: create_bar_plot(   data,   x_axis_var = "event_month",   y_axis_var = "n",   xaxisLabel,   yaxisLabel,   title,   flg_darkMode = FALSE )

title: Create Interactive Bar Plot with echarts4r ‚Äî create_bar_plot
text: data data frame containing data plotted. x_axis_var x axis variable name data. y_axis_var y axis variable name data. xaxisLabel Character string specifying label x-axis. yaxisLabel Character string specifying label y-axis. title Character string specifying title plot. flg_darkMode Logical value (TRUE/FALSE) indicating whether use dark mode styling. Default FALSE (light mode).

title: Create Interactive Bar Plot with echarts4r ‚Äî create_bar_plot
text: echarts4r visualization object can displayed Shiny app R Markdown document.

title: Create Interactive Bar Plot with echarts4r ‚Äî create_bar_plot
text: function provides several interactive features: Data zooming slider bottom Tooltips showing exact values hover Option switch bar line representations Export functionality saving chart image Data view examining underlying data styling automatically adjusts based flg_darkMode parameter, appropriate color schemes light dark modes.

title: Create Species Dropdown Based on Radio Button Selection ‚Äî dropdownBasedOnRadioBtn
text: radioBtn_search_byName current value radio button input radioBtn_search_byNameID specific choice value check (e.g., "Vernacular" "Scientific") id1 Input ID first dropdown option (typically vernacular names) label1 Label text first dropdown option choices1 List choices first dropdown option id2 Input ID second dropdown option (typically scientific names) label2 Label text second dropdown option choices2 List choices second dropdown option

what: Filter biodiversity data based on search criteria ‚Äî SelectedbdData
title: Filter biodiversity data based on search criteria ‚Äî SelectedbdData
text: function subsets biodiversity data based user search criteria species vernacular name scientific name. function handles two search modes determined radio button selection.

title: Filter biodiversity data based on search criteria ‚Äî SelectedbdData
Filter biodiversity data based on search criteria ‚Äî SelectedbdData
text: radioBtn_search_byName Character. current value search mode radio button. radioBtn_search_byNameID Character. ID value indicates search vernacular name mode. searchByVerOrSciName Character. primary search term entered user. selectedByVerOrSciName Character. secondary selection made user.

title: Filter biodiversity data based on search criteria ‚Äî SelectedbdData
text: data frame containing filtered biodiversity data matches vernacular name scientific name criteria.

title: Filter biodiversity data based on search criteria ‚Äî SelectedbdData
text: function behaves differently based search mode: radioBtn_search_byName equals radioBtn_search_byNameID, filters vernacular name first (searchByVerOrSciName) scientific name (selectedByVerOrSciName). Otherwise, filters scientific name first (searchByVerOrSciName) vernacular name (selectedByVerOrSciName).

what: Update dropdown inputs based on radio button selection ‚Äî updateDropdownBasedOnRadioBtnValues
title: Update dropdown inputs based on radio button selection ‚Äî updateDropdownBasedOnRadioBtnValues
text: Updates searchable dropdown inputs species selection based user's choice searching vernacular name scientific name. user selects species one dropdown, function updates corresponding value dropdown.

title: Update dropdown inputs based on radio button selection ‚Äî updateDropdownBasedOnRadioBtnValues
code: updateDropdownBasedOnRadioBtnValues(   radioBtn_search_byName,   radioBtn_search_byNameID_ver,   id_ver_name,   scientificName_str,   vernacularName_str,   id_selected_sci_name,   radioBtn_search_byNameID_sci,   id_sci_name,   id_selected_ver_name,   session )

title: Update dropdown inputs based on radio button selection ‚Äî updateDropdownBasedOnRadioBtnValues
text: radioBtn_search_byName current value radio button determines search method (vernacular scientific name) radioBtn_search_byNameID_ver value radio button corresponds searching vernacular name id_ver_name input value vernacular name dropdown scientificName_str Constant string identifier scientific name, typically "scientificName" vernacularName_str Constant string identifier vernacular name, typically "vernacularName" id_selected_sci_name input value matching scientific name dropdown radioBtn_search_byNameID_sci value radio button corresponds searching scientific name id_sci_name input value scientific name dropdown id_selected_ver_name input value matching vernacular name dropdown session Shiny session object
